thread.title: Watch: Derek Kellogg says UMass is getting healthy, no update on Luwane Pipkins yet (video)
thread.title_full: Watch: Derek Kellogg says UMass is getting healthy, no update on Luwane Pipkins yet (video)

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: Watch: Derek Kellogg says UMass is getting healthy, no update on Luwane Pipkins yet (video)
text:
Comments 
AMHERST â€“ University of Massachusetts basketball coach Derek Kellogg met with reporters Wednesday, touching on a number of issues in his usual pre-practice interview. 
It's early yet and the Minutemen's practice schedule is still pretty uneven, but Kellogg seemed pleased with the steps the team has taken so far in the preseason. 
Notably, Kellogg said there have been no new developments in the ongoing eligibility case of incoming freshman Luwane Pipkins. UMass is still waiting to hear word from the NCAA Clearinghouse on whether the point guard will get to suit up this year 
Last week, UMass was hampered somewhat by minor injuries to Malik Hines and Seth Berger. Now, Kellogg said, the team is just about at full strength, with the exception of transfer guard Zach Lewis, who missed Tuesday's due to illness (Lewis is sitting out 2015-16 per NCAA rules). 
Other topics included sophomore point guard C.J. Anderson's growing role, the development of Donte Clark and the introduction of Texas A&M transfer Antwan Space . 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
